description:
Data Analyst

Job Description: The Data Analyst will play a critical role in supporting our servicing area by developing and maintaining reports, analyzing data, and providing insights that drive strategic decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis within the mortgage servicing industry and a proven record of delivering actionable insights.

The ideal candidate for this role demonstrates a strong bias toward action, proactively identifying and resolving issues with both timely efficiency and precision. They will have a solid understanding of Business Intelligence initiatives and a robust background in data management and analysis, enabling them to deliver impactful insights and drive value for the organization.

This position is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about leveraging data and BI tools to support business decision-making while working collaboratively within a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement solutions utilizing Microsoft SQL Server.
Translate business requirements into specific technical designs.
Adhere to industry coding standards / clean code principles.
Follow standard design, development, testing, and implementation phases of the Software Development Life Cycle

· Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs. Develop Queries for ad-hoc reporting requests from managers.

· Prepare reports for executive leadership that effectively communicate trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data in conjunction with a new Tableau reporting process.

· Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.

· Identify opportunities to automate reporting processes and improve efficiency.

Collaborate with business teams to define data requirements and reporting needs.
Stay up to date with, research, and recommend current trends in Microsoft SQL Server and Database tools
Work with multiple teams to develop new systems and expand functionality to existing applications

Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field is preferred.
Minimum 3-5 years of Microsoft SQL Server development experience.
Hands on experience writing T-SQL to create schemas, table structures, stored procedures, functions and complex queries with CTEs, temporary tables and variables.
Experience with database performance tuning and troubleshooting
Experience with data warehousing and replication techniques
Strong understanding of database design, normalization, and optimization techniques
Experience in a reporting or data analyst role, preferably within the mortgage servicing industry.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at querying complex data, report writing, and presenting findings.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Power BI, Tableau). Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.).
Familiarity with database management systems (e.g., SQL Server, Snowflake, MySQL).
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate complex data insights in a clear and concise manner. Role will work closely with business unit managers.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to clearly communicate and share solutions with fellow team members
This role requires flexibility, as additional responsibilities and tasks may be assigned based on evolving business needs.
Team player and a quick learner, able to easily adjust to new project requirements

Location: Addison, TX

Position Location: on-site

This job specification should not be construed to imply that these requirements are the exclusive standards of the position. Click n’ Close is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other characteristics protected by applicable law.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $95,000.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Health savings account
Life insurance
Paid time off
Parental leave
Retirement plan
Vision insurance

Compensation Package:

Bonus opportunities

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Addison, TX 75001
